thread.title: Anti-Trump protests kick off near Super Bowl LI site
thread.title_full: Anti-Trump protests kick off near Super Bowl LI site

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Anti-Trump protests kick off near Super Bowl LI site

organizations.name: kansas city chiefs of the afl

text:
Anti-Trump protests kick off near Super Bowl LI site More than five hours ahead of Super Bowl LI, before the New England Patriots and Atlanta Falcons even arrived NRG Stadium, the anti-Trump protests kicked off. Post to Facebook Anti-Trump protests kick off near Super Bowl LI site More than five hours ahead of Super Bowl LI, before the New England Patriots and Atlanta Falcons even arrived NRG Stadium, the anti-Trump protests kicked off.  //usat.ly/2kCCvPS   Anti-Trump protests kick off near Super Bowl LI site Josh Peter , USA TODAY Sports Published 1:58   | Updated 5 minutes ago CLOSE x Share Chrissy Teigen and John Legend sound off on Trump and Teigen's tweets to the president. USA TODAY Sports Anti-Trump protests in Houston, near the Super Bowl LI site. (Photo: Josh Peter, USA TODAY Sports) 
HOUSTON – More than five hours ahead of Super Bowl LI, before the New England Patriots and Atlanta Falcons even arrived NRG Stadium, the anti-Trump protests kicked off. 
At noon, about 500 people gathered for a march starting at Hermann Park. They broke into a loud chant, bellowing: “Hey, hey, ho, ho, Donald Trump has got to go.” 
Less than 30 feet away, 15 police officers on horseback were lined up, and a helicopter circled. The groups participating in the march that was scheduled to follow a two-mile route to the stadium included Black Lives Matter, the local Democratic party, the ACLU and the communist party, among others. 
Among the protesters was Jane McEldowney, 62, a lawyer and licensed mental health professional from Houston. She said she began joining protests shortly after the presidential election in November. 
A 'Resist Trump" banner at an anti-Trump protest. (Photo: Josh Peter, USA TODAY Sports) 
“I count myself among the complacent until now,” she said. “I have been inspired by Donald Trump, not how he intended.” Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed.
